timeline.message: Add methods to obtain edge states by edge key
Always return storage direction for loops
Fix edge keys in case edges are stored the other way around

timeline.bodyText: Should we call it getEdgeIteratorState(int) instead?
timeline.author: easbar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,6 +82,13 @@
      */
     EdgeIteratorState getEdgeIteratorState(int edgeId, int adjNode);
 
+    /**
+     * Returns the edge state for the given edge key
+     *
+     * @see EdgeIteratorState#getEdgeKey()
+     */
+    EdgeIteratorState getEdgeIteratorStateForKey(int edgeKey);

timeline.author: easbar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -73,6 +74,16 @@ public void setBool(boolean reverse, IntsRef ref, boolean value) {
      */
     int getEdge();
 
+    /**
+     * Returns the edge key of the current edge. The edge id can be derived from the edge key by calling
+     * {@link GHUtility#getEdgeFromEdgeKey(int)}, but the edge key also contains information about the
+     * direction of the edge. The edge key is even when the edge is oriented in storage direction and odd
+     * otherwise. You can use the edge key to retrieve an edge state in the associated direction using
+     * {@link Graph#getEdgeIteratorStateForKey(int)}. Loop edges are always returned in 'forward' direction even when
+     * you use an odd edge key.
+     */
+    int getEdgeKey();

replies.bodyText: Oh yeah, excellent. I‘m not a fan of the (boolean reverse) parameter anywhere, I just kept to the convention. Let‘s drop it.
replies.author: michaz

replies.bodyText: Ok so we keep edgeState.getEdgeKey() here 👍
replies.author: easbar

timeline.bodyText: @michaz, can you check WrapperGraph here? I was not sure what is and what is not needed here.
timeline.author: easbar

replies.bodyText: postponed until we need this method
replies.author: easbar
